llm.feedback:
Up | 6–12 months | AI-driven productivity uplift and retraining/UBI policy progress bolster margins and pricing power for durable franchises | What to watch: pace of AI adoption, retraining/UBI efficacy, and moat cash-flow resilience | 60% (NL5YYTLF2)(IGP1Q4ZEJ)
Up | 12–24 months | Automation-accelerated regime with faster displacement requiring retraining and targeted supports; policy stability and UBI uptake help stabilize consumption and support moat valuations | What to watch: retraining outcomes, UBI policy execution, and the durability of moat cash flows | 55% (NL5YYTLF2)(IGP1Q4ZEJ)
Down | 3–6 months | Policy missteps and social-friction constraints on demand, including potential UBI/retraining failures that fail to stabilize consumption | What to watch: unemployment in automation-exposed sectors, social cohesion indicators, and policy delivery on retraining/UBI | 40% (NL5YYTLF2)
Down | 0–3 weeks | Macro credibility risk and tariff pass-through could prompt hawkish repricing and risk-off in rate-sensitive sectors as central-bank signals and tariff dynamics unfold | What to watch: CPI/PCE prints, payrolls, tariff progress, and ECB/FOMC rhetoric shifts | 50% (U6HXAJR4J)(S15934PBQ)
